Settings module¶

class robotice.conf.Settings(worker=None, conf_dir='/srv/robotice/config/', workers_dir='/srv/robotice')¶

Main object which contains all infromation about systems

you can change config PATH

if you set system variable R_CONFIG_DIR and R_WORKERS_DIR

::in directory R_CONFIG_DIR is expected devices.yml, systems.yml, plans.yml ::in directory R_WORKERS_DIR is expected worker_monitos.yml etc.

actuators¶

return actuators for all systems, but add system_name variable

broker¶

broker in string format redis://localhost:6379/9

database¶

database connection now is supported only redis

get_actuator_device(device_name)¶

return actuator from host devices

get_plan(device_name, device_metric=None)¶

return tuple (system, plan)

get_system_plans¶

return array of tuples [(system, plan),]

load_conf(_type)¶

encapsulation logic for load yaml

Args:
name (str): The name to use.
Kwargs:
state (bool): Current state to be in.
Returns:

int. The return code:

0 -- Success!
1 -- No good.
2 -- Try again.
Raises:
AttributeError, KeyError
metering¶

method create instance of statsd client method expected metering settings in worker config file metering: host: localhost is default port: 8125 is default sample_rate: 1 is default prefix: robotice is default

setup_app(worker)¶

main method which init all settings for specific role

class robotice.conf.RoboticeSettings(worker=None, conf_dir='/srv/robotice/config/', workers_dir='/srv/robotice')¶

A singleton implementation of Settings such that all dealings with settings get the same instance no matter what. There can be only one. you can use RoboticeSettings(‘reasoner’) or setup_app declared below

class robotice.conf.Grains(path='/srv/robotice/grains.yml')¶

grains generated from salt note: not using now

excepted structure:

grains:
hostname: redis1.box.robotice.cz os_family: Debian cpu_arch: amd64
robotice.conf.setup_app(worker)¶

dealing with global singleton and load configs easiest way how you get settings instance is RoboticeSettings(‘reasoner’)
